features: LEVELS OF FUN: With six different levels for the balls to travel, this tower is sure to be tons of fun. Each layer of the tower features a vibrant color and drops the ball in a different spot which makes it enticing for children. They're sure to have tons of fun watching the balls travel down the tower.

EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT: The Kidoozie Whirl 'n Go Ball Tower helps your child learn cause and effect early as they see what happens as they drop the ball into the top level. It also develops fine motor skills, encouraging hands-on activity and sensory stimulation.
FUN RATTLE NOISES: This isn't your typical ball tower; these balls make sounds that your child will love. Rattling sounds will catch kids' attention as the balls descend the ramps one at a time.

WHERE FUN BEGINS: Kidoozie toys are engaging, educational and FUN. Our broad range of high-quality toys have won numerous awards and are safe and well designed. Innovative toys encourage movement, problemsolving and pretend play through various themes.

PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS: Package contains (1) Kidoozie Whirl 'n Go Ball Tower. Includes six colorful levels and four balls. Features fun rattling sounds the encourage and excite children. Recommended for children ages 9 to 24 months.
body.description: With five different levels for the balls to travel, this tower is sure to be tons of fun. Each comes in a different color and drops the ball in a different spot which makes it enticing for children. They're sure to have tons of fun watching the balls drop. Package contains (1) Kidoozie Whirl 'N Go Tower. Includes six colorful levels and four fun balls.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Drop, swirl, rattle & spin! Featuring Six swirling levels and 4 bead-filled balls, babies will have a blast placing the balls at the top and watching them roll, spin, and rattle to the bottom! Fun, visual stimulation! The balls are sized just right for small hands, so they are easy for baby to grab, shake and place at the top of the tower!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My one year old loves it!
reviews.reviewText: My one year old loves this toy! It keeps him entertained for a solid 20-30 minutes and he gets a kick watching the balls go down this tower. the base is not very sturdy and topples over quite easily but other than that all of it works great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Buy it earlier
reviews.reviewText: I wish we had this months ago. Our LO is 20 months, but this would have been entertaining for him as soon as he could sit up. It does not get boring for him, only draw back is the levels detach from eachother quite easily

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for development play
reviews.reviewText: We ordered this after my son liked one from his therapy session, it’s a good size and I like how you can make it shorter or taller. Only thing I would say it’s not so sturdy it’s easy to knock down and the top part pulls out easily but overall good price for what you get.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nephew really enjoyed
reviews.reviewText: Ladies and gentlemen, gather 'round because I have discovered the holy grail of toddler entertainment – the Kidoozie Ball Drop! This tower of educational delight has turned my living room into a laughter-filled learning center, and I'm here to share the joy with you.First things first, this toddler toy is like a miniature engineering marvel. It's a tower of twisting, turning, tumbling brilliance that captivates the attention of little ones faster than you can say "educational masterpiece." I've never seen my toddler so invested in a toy – it's like a mini scientist discovering the secrets of gravity.The colorful design is not just eye candy; it's like a visual feast for the tiny humans. Each level is a different color, creating a rainbow of excitement that not only stimulates their little brains but also coordinates with the crayon explosion happening in every corner of my house.Now, let's talk about the balls. Oh, the balls! They're not just balls; they're like tiny ambassadors of joy rolling down the tower of enlightenment. Watching my toddler's eyes light up as they follow the balls' journey is a comedy show and a magic trick all rolled into one. It's like witnessing the discovery of perpetual motion, toddler-style.The Kidoozie Ball Drop is not just a toy; it's a symphony of sound and laughter. The clickity-clack of the balls as they descend is like the soundtrack to a toddler's joyous exploration. It's a noise that warms the heart, and I've caught myself humming the tune during work meetings. Who needs a calming playlist when you have the Kidoozie Ball Drop melody?And the best part? It's educational! Yes, you heard it right. This tower of toddler bliss is secretly teaching my little one about cause and effect, fine motor skills, and the art of giggling uncontrollably. It's like a covert mission to turn playtime into a brain-boosting extravaganza.In conclusion, the Kidoozie Ball Drop is not just a toddler toy; it's a parenting ally. It turns learning into a joyous adventure and brings a whole new meaning to the phrase "rolling with laughter." If you're ready to transform playtime into an educational escapade filled with colorful excitement, this tower is your ticket to toddler-approved brilliance. Get ready to witness the magic of the Kidoozie Ball Drop – where education meets entertainment, and laughter reigns supreme!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple and so fun!
reviews.reviewText: Debated getting my son this for his second birthday as I wasn’t sure how long we’d get use out of it before he lost interest. My sister in law has it and he’s loved playing with it at her house a few times. We’re going on three months and it’s played with almost daily! The top section(s) do come off pretty regularly, but they slide back on easily. The balls fall out of the run a lot too, but he just laughs and we yell “uh oh ___ ball jumped out!” and we go on playing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My children had one of these when they were young and would play with it for hours! I bought this one for my 6 month old grandson, it’s still fun to play with, until the baby grabs it, like they do, and it falls apart so easily. Made of very flimsy material! The balls are great and make different sounds.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great gift for a small child
reviews.reviewText: Was a Christmas gift for my 1 year old grandson. It is well built, sturdy, colorful and the balls make a jingle sound. He loves it…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Even grandma likes it!
reviews.reviewText: Cute toy! Well made! Something my 1 year old can play with. And his older siblings like it as well!
Quality is good. structure is stable and it functions as marketed. Really one of a good toy for babies.
Our kid played a lot with it. Also likes to disassemble and reorganize it.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3 year old and 1 year old both like it
reviews.reviewText: I'd give it a 5 if the pieces stuck together more tightly but my two sons both love it. Looks just like the picture
I like it. Only thing is that the balls go so fast that they fall out before they could reach the bottom.
Parfait conforme à la photo. Ma fille aime beaucoup.
